s.text: People who intended to lose weight, and who did so, also had a slightly higher mortality than those who did not intend to lose weight and whose weight was stable.
If you are overweight, then losing weight is good for your health, surely?
Information on mortality was then collected over the next 18 years; the authors then analyzed mortality in relation to intention to lose weight and actual weight change.
Perhaps the safest interpretation of these results is that by the time adults are overweight, the health benefits of losing weight are not clear-cut.
